info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 4 at 9:59PM EDT until May 9 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Petersburg.
.Rainfall over the last several days totaling 1 to 2 inches along the lower White River has led to minor flooding at Petersburg. Flooding is expected to continue into Friday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...Until late Friday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Sunday /8:30 PM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 15.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 17.7 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning to 7.7 feet Tuesday, May 13. It will rise to 7.9 feet Wednesday, May 14. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 200 PM EDT /100 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
